heading: Today, Christmas Day
text: Mostly cloudy. Snow showers likely in the northern mountains, and in the valleys near the Vermont/Québec border, with 1 to 3 inches, scattered elsewhere from the Adirondacks and Route 4 northward, with a trace to 2 inches. Periods of blowing snow. Morning highs from the mid 20s to around 30 north, and upper 20s to mid 30s in the south. Winds becoming northwest 10 to 15 mph, gusting to 30 mph.

heading: Tonight
text: Mostly cloudy. Chance of an evening snow shower northeast. Much colder, with lows from 5 below to 5 above in the south and in the Champlain Valley, 5 below to 15 below elsewhere north. Northwest winds 10 to 15 mph, gusting to 30 mph early.

heading: Friday
text: Mostly to partly sunny, but cold, with highs in the single digits to lower teens north, mid teens to lower 20s in the south. North winds 5 to 15 mph, diminishing in the afternoon.
